      • appendByteArrayToFile

        public static void appendByteArrayToFile(java.lang.String fileName,
                                         byte[] byteArray)
                                  throws java.io.IOException
         appends the byte array at the end of file.
        Parameters:
        fileName - Name of file in which array needs to be appended
        byteArray - byte array that needs to be appended.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If file can not be opened/closed or File is being used by some other application.

      • compareTwoFiles

        public static boolean compareTwoFiles(java.lang.String srcFileName,
                                      java.lang.String destFileName)
                               throws java.io.IOException
         Compares file into byte chunks and return true if both file are same,otherwise returns false.

 Chunk size is by default 1024. You can change it depending upon free heap size in JVM.

 Note : I had to implement this method as Default Assertion with JUnit doesn't work for files larger than Integer.MAX_VALUE size in Java.
 This method works for any file size theoretically.
        Parameters:
        srcFileName - first file to be compared
        destFileName - second file to be compared
        Returns:
        true if same, otherwise false
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If source/destination can not be opened/closed/read/write.

      • copyFileInChunks

        public static void copyFileInChunks(java.lang.String source,
                                    java.lang.String dest,
                                    long seekSrcBytes,
                                    long bytesToRead)
                             throws java.io.IOException
         copies bytes from source file and appends it in the destination file.

 It copies bytes from input file starting from offset specified by seekSrcBytes.and Copies the bytes specified by bytesToRead at the end of destination file.

 For the performance purposes, it reads bytes into chunk size and copies that chunk in destination file.
 It repeats the procedure till there are any bytes to be copied.
 This parameter can be configured in SolutionConfig.BYTES_TO_READ_AT_A_TIME
 This parameter should be set based on your heap size of JVM.
        Parameters:
        source - Source file from where bytes needs to be read.
        dest - Destination file in which read bytes needs to be appended
        seekSrcBytes - starting byte number from where bytes needs to be read in source file.
        bytesToRead - total number of bytes to be read starting from seekSrcBytes
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If source/destination can not be opened/closed/read/write.

      • getFileSize

        public static long getFileSize(java.lang.String fileName)
                        throws java.io.IOException,
                               java.io.FileNotFoundException
         returns the size of file in bytes.
        Parameters:
        fileName - FileName whose size needs to be determined.
        Returns:
        size of file in bytes
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If file can not be opened/closed or File is being used by some other application.
        java.io.FileNotFoundException - If File not found.
